00012 // Handler for the USB controller interrupt
00013 // Defers the call to the USB_Handler function.
00014 //---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

00016 volatile portBASE_TYPE isTaskWokenByPostInUsbIrq = pdFALSE;
00017 
00018 void ISR_USB( void )
00019 {
00020     isTaskWokenByPostInUsbIrq = pdFALSE;
00021 
00022     // USB_Handler may also call callbacks established by SER_Read()/SER_Write()
00023     //
00024     sSer.EventHandler ();
00025 
00026     AT91F_AIC_AcknowledgeIt( AT91C_BASE_AIC );
00027 
00028     // If an event caused a task to unblock then we call "Yield from ISR" to ensure 
00029     // that the unblocked task is the task that executes when the interrupt completes
00030     // if the unblocked task has a priority higher than the interrupted task.
00031     //
00032     if( isTaskWokenByPostInUsbIrq )
00033         portYIELD_FROM_ISR();
00034     }

00040 portTASK_FUNCTION( USBXMTR::MainTask, pvParameters )
00041 {
00042     (void) pvParameters; // The parameters are not used.
00043 
00044 #ifdef TR_INFO    
00045     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00046     TRACE_INFO( "USBXMTR: Main Task\n" );
00047     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00048 #endif
00049

00051

00058 bool USBXMTR::Put( void* data, uint len, portTickType xTicksToWait )
00059 {
00060     // Wait enough space to fit 2-byte length + data
00061     //
00062     if ( ! semaFull.Wait( len + 2, xTicksToWait ) )
00063         return false;
00064 
00065     // Lock pWrite mutex
00066     //
00067     LockWrite ();
00068 
00069     // Put 2-byte length into circular buffer: MSB first
00070     //
00071     *pWrite++ = ( len >> 8 ) & 0xFF;
00072     if ( pWrite >= pMax )
00073         pWrite = buf;
00074     *pWrite++ = len & 0xFF;
00075     if ( pWrite >= pMax )
00076         pWrite = buf;
00077 
00078     // Put data into circular buffer
00079     //
00080     uchar* pSrc = (uchar*) data;
00081 
00082     if ( pWrite + len < pMax )
00083     {
00084         // Put flat data (not crossing upper boundary)
00085         //
00086         for( uint i = 0; i < len; i++ )
00087             *pWrite++ = *pSrc++;
00088         }
00089     else
00090     {
00091         // Put circular data (crossing upper boundary)
00092         //
00093         uint len2 = pWrite + len - pMax;
00094         uint len1 = len - len2;
00095 
00096         for( uint i = 0; i < len1; i++ )
00097             *pWrite++ = *pSrc++;
00098 
00099         pWrite = buf;
00100 
00101         for( uint i = 0; i < len2; i++ )
00102             *pWrite++ = *pSrc++;
00103         }
00104 
00105     // Notify Transmitter()
00106     //
00107     semaEmpty.Release( len + 2 );
00108 
00109     // Unlock pWrite mutex
00110     //
00111     UnlockWrite ();
00112 
00113     return true;
00114     }
00115 
00116 void USBXMTR:: Transmitter( void )
00117 {
00118     // Wait 2-byte header
00119     //
00120     do ; while( ! semaEmpty.Wait( 2, 1000 ) );
00121 
00122     // Retrieve data length from packet header
00123     //
00124     uint len = *pRead++;
00125     if ( pRead >= pMax )
00126         pRead = buf;
00127     len = ( len << 8 ) + *pRead++;
00128     if ( pRead >= pMax )
00129         pRead = buf;
00130 
00131     // Wait the rest of data
00132     //
00133     do ; while( ! semaEmpty.Wait( len, 1000 ) );
00134 
00135     // Send data over USB
00136     //
00137     bool isSent = false;
00138 
00139     for ( int i = 0; i < 100; i++ )
00140     {
00141         taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00142         int rc = sSer.Write( pRead, len, Callback_f( OnSendCompleted ), this, buf, pMax );
00143         taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00144 
00145         if ( rc == USB::USB_STATUS_SUCCESS )
00146         {
00147             isSent = true;
00148             break;
00149             }
00150 
00151         // USB endopoint is not ready; wait and retry
00152         //
00153         vTaskDelay( 1 );
00154 
00155         if ( i == 0 )
00156         {
00157 #ifdef TR_ERROR
00158             taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00159             TRACE_ERROR( "USBXMTR: Write failed\n" );
00160             taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00161 #endif
00162             }
00163         }
00164 
00165     // Wait for transmission to end
00166     //
00167     if ( isSent )
00168     {
00169         do ; while( ! semaSent.Wait( 1, 1000 ) );
00170 
00171         if ( bStatus != USB::USB_STATUS_SUCCESS ) 
00172         {
00173 #ifdef TR_ERROR
00174             taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00175             TRACE_ERROR( "USBXMTR: Transfer error\n" );
00176             taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00177 #endif
00178             }
00179         else
00180         {
00181 #ifdef TR_DEBUG_M
00182             taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00183             TRACE_DEBUG_M( "USBXMTR: Sent %5u, %5u; RC = %d\n", 
00184                     dBytesTransferred, dBytesRemaining, bStatus );
00185             taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00186 #endif            
00187             }
00188         }
00189 
00190     // Advance pRead
00191     //
00192     pRead += len;
00193     if ( pRead >= pMax )
00194         pRead -= bufSize;
00195 
00196     // Release space back to circular buffer and unblock some USBXMTR::Put
00197     // waiting for more space.
00198     //
00199     semaFull.Release( len + 2 );
00200     }

00205 
00206 portTASK_FUNCTION( USBRCVR::MainTask, pvParameters )
00207 {
00208     (void) pvParameters; // The parameters are not used.
00209 
00210 #ifdef TR_INFO    
00211     taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00212     TRACE_INFO( "USBRCVR: Main Task\n" );
00213     taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00214 #endif
00215 
00216     // Initialize the USB CDC driver
00217     sSer.Init ();
00218     
00219 #ifdef TR_INFO    
00220     taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00221     TRACE_INFO( "Connecting USB... \n" );
00222     taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00223 #endif
00224 
00225     // Wait for the device to be powered before connecting it
00226     while ( ! sSer.IsPowered () )
00227         vTaskDelay( 1 );
00228 
00229     // Connect
00230     sSer.Connect ();
00231 
00232 #ifdef TR_INFO    
00233     taskENTER_CRITICAL();
00234     TRACE_INFO( "USB Connected\n" );
00235     taskEXIT_CRITICAL();
00236 #endif
00237 
00238     // Initialize receiver (start receiving data)
00239     usbIn.Initialize ();
00240 
00241     for(;;)
00242     {
00243         usbIn.Receiver ();
00244         usbIn.ReadMoreData ();
00245         }
00246     }
00247 
00248 void USBRCVR::Receiver( void )
00249 {
00250     // Check whether read callback has returned already found in FIFO. If not
00251     // then we should wait for read callback to complete.
00252     //
00253     if ( bStatus != USB::USB_STATUS_IMMEDREAD )
00254     {
00255         // Wait callback to receive data
00256         //
00257         do ; while( ! semaReceived.Wait( 1, 1000 ) );
00258         
00259         // Check CCDC::Read() callback status
00260         //
00261         if ( bStatus != USB::USB_STATUS_SUCCESS ) 
00262         {
00263 #ifdef TR_ERROR            
00264             taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00265             TRACE_ERROR( "USBRCVR: Transfer error\n" );
00266             taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00267 #endif
00268             return;
00269             }
00270         }
00271 
00272 #ifdef TR_DEBUG_M
00273     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00274     TRACE_DEBUG_M( "USBRCVR: Got %6u, %5u; RC = %d\n", 
00275             dBytesTransferred, dBytesRemaining, bStatus );
00276     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();
00277 #endif
00278 
00279     if ( dBytesTransferred == 0 )
00280         return;
00281 
00282     int dataLen = dBytesTransferred - sizeof( XPI_OMSG_HEADER );
00283 
00284     // Loopback XPI_OMSG messages without proper header
00285     //
00286     if ( dataLen < 0 
00287         || sMsg.magicMSB != XPI_MSG_MAGIC_MSB 
00288         || sMsg.magicLSB != XPI_MSG_MAGIC_LSB 
00289         )
00290     {
00291         if ( sMsg.magicMSB == '?' )
00292             xpi.DumpStatus ();
00293         else
00294             usbOut.Put( buf, dBytesTransferred, 1000 );
00295         return;
00296         }
00297 
00298     // Process XPI_OMSG depending on message type
00299     //
00300     switch( sMsg.type )
00301     {
00302         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00303         case XPI_OMSG_NULL:
00304             break;
00305 
00306         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00307         case XPI_OMSG_LOOP:
00308         {
00309             if ( sMsg.subtype != 0 )
00310             {
00311                 // Simulate FPGA I/O
00312                 //
00313                 for ( int i = 0; i <= dataLen / 32; i++ )
00314                 {
00315                     taskENTER_CRITICAL ();
00316                     FPGA_BegWrite ();
00317                     FPGA_Write( XPI_W_PAGE_ADDR, 1 ); // Page 1
00318                     FPGA_BegRead ();
00319                     for ( int j = 0; j < 64; j++ )
00320                         (void) FPGA_Read( XPI_R_P1_BOARD_POS );
00321                     taskEXIT_CRITICAL ();  
00322                     }
00323                 }
00324 
00325             // Loopback packet to usbOut.
00326             //
00327             sMsg.type    = XPI_IMSG_LOOP;
00328             sMsg.subtype = 0;
00329             usbOut.Put( buf, dBytesTransferred, 1000 );
00330             }
00331             break;
00332 
00333         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00334         case XPI_OMSG_XSVF_START:
00335         {
00336             // Get XSVF parameters
00337             //
00338             bool traceLevel = dataLen >= 1 ? sMsg.data[ 0 ] : 0;
00339             bool parseOnly  = dataLen >= 2 ? sMsg.data[ 1 ] : false;
00340             
00341             // Configure std output for XSVF trace (default is null device)
00342             //
00343             if ( dataLen >= 3 && sMsg.data[ 2 ] == 2 )
00344             {
00345                 tracef_open( 1, us1_putc, /*LF2CRLF=*/ true, /*TimeStamp=*/ true );
00346                 }
00347             else if ( dataLen >= 3 && sMsg.data[ 2 ] == 1 )
00348             {
00349                 tracef_open( 1, usb_putc, /*LF2CRLF=*/ false, /*TimeStamp=*/ false );
00350                 }
00351             else
00352             {
00353                 tracef_open( 1, null_putc, /*LF2CRLF=*/ false, /*TimeStamp=*/ false );
00354                 }
00355 
00356             // Enable (start) XSVF player
00357             //
00358             xsvf.Enable( traceLevel, parseOnly );
00359             }
00360             break;
00361 
00362         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00363         case XPI_OMSG_XSVF_DATA:
00364         {
00365             if ( dataLen > 0 )
00366             {
00367                 xsvf.LockBuffer( sMsg.data, dataLen );
00368                 }
00369             }
00370             break;
00371 
00372         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00373         case XPI_OMSG_FPGA_INIT:
00374         {
00375             bool coldStart    = dataLen >= 1 ? sMsg.data[ 0 ] : false;
00376             bool forcePassive = dataLen >= 2 ? sMsg.data[ 1 ] : false;
00377             xpi.InitializeFPGA( coldStart, forcePassive );
00378             }
00379             break;
00380 
00381         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00382         case XPI_OMSG_QUERY:
00383         {
00384             if ( sMsg.subtype == 0x01 )
00385                 xpi.DumpStatus ();
00386             else
00387                 sysDumpStatus ();
00388             }
00389             break;
00390 
00391         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00392         case XPI_OMSG_LOG_CFG:
00393         {
00394             xpi.SetTraceMask( dataLen >= 1 ? sMsg.data[ 0 ] : 0 );
00395             }
00396             break;
00397 
00398         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00399         case XPI_OMSG_SC_DATA:
00400         {
00401             xpi.Put( sMsg.data, dataLen, 100 );
00402             }
00403             break;
00404 
00405         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00406         case XPI_OMSG_FC_CMD:
00407         {
00408             if ( dataLen >= 2 ) // Addr with D1 and D0
00409             {
00410                 int card = sMsg.data[ 0 ] & 0x3F;
00411 
00412                 FPGA_FC_Command( ( card << 2 ) | ( sMsg.data[ 1 ] & 0x03 )  );
00413                 vTaskDelay( 2 );
00414                 }
00415             else if ( dataLen >= 1 ) // Only Addr
00416             {
00417                 int card = sMsg.data[ 0 ] & 0x3F;
00418 
00419                 // Turn off and reset the board
00420                 //
00421                 FPGA_FC_Command( ( card << 2 ) | 0x00 );
00422                 vTaskDelay( 2 );
00423 
00424                 // Turn on the board
00425                 //
00426                 FPGA_FC_Command( ( card << 2 ) | 0x01 );
00427                 vTaskDelay( 2 );
00428 
00429                 // Is the board installed?
00430                 //
00431                 if ( FPGA_FC_Command( ( card << 2 ) | 0x03 ) )
00432                 {
00433                     vTaskDelay( 2 );
00434 
00435                     // Is the board turned on and installed?
00436                     //
00437                     FPGA_FC_Command( ( card << 2 ) | 0x02 );
00438                     }
00439                 vTaskDelay( 2 );
00440                 }
00441             }
00442             break;
00443 
00444         //-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
00445         default:
00446             // TODO: issue warning "unknown XPI_OMSG"
00447             break;
00448         }
00449     }
